column5: So, the ice went out. What did the weather do in the ear falls, red lake area the last week or two? Curious if the water has gotten warm enough for the walleye to spawn or if they're still holdin their eggs. Anyone know? Thanks! Good luck to the opener guys!

When the ice is out of the incoming rivers or a lake with no tributaries, walleyes will commence spawning activity and it will last 2-3 weeks ish. All fish species don't spawn at the exact same time or area so there is a period of time in which it takes, not one single event
Walleyes will get it on, while some humans bicker about which bathroom to use.

The main factor with walleye spawning is water temperature. They prefer somewhere around 50 f.they stage near there spawning areas till temps rise and will then go to where they spawn.some walleyes that spawn on shorelines might spawn later if temps are not right.these fish could atvtimes still have eggs in them as they might spawn later.was out last werkend for lakectrout and the main lake was at 42f and some bays were at 46-47f.so parts of thectributaries the walleyes spawn in would have been up in the 50 f range and doing there business.pike will have spawned already as they spawn much earlier.

The 2016 spawn in northern Quebec,is going to be a little late,seeing some lakes are still frozen over.Late spring in this area.they should be ready for the opener.The Lake I have been fishing for the last 15 yrs.,Lac Hebert,is a very unique lac.It feeds its self by Ground springs,All water Rivers and streams flow out of the lake.Its a Walleye factory
Water Temps just south of kenora are at 47 degrees. Weather has been cool. Around 32 today so not much warm up happening. Sent from my SM-T800 using Tapatalk
